4550/A0/04/104/006.status_value: Implementation of NPA VAC was completed at the end of June and positively evaluated. NCPA II continues to be implemented within the established district Child Protection Systems in 35 districts in Tanzania and Zanzibar  19 with direct UNICEF support.  A new National Plan of Action on Violence Against Women and Children is near finalization  with oversight responsibility elevated to the Prime Minister's Office.

4550/A0/04/104/006.status_value: UNICEF has supported the introduction of a new register that enables child protection data to be captured through the Health Management Information System.  This tool will be used by all districts that are implementing the second National Costed Plan of Action for Most Vulnerable Children (NCPA MVC II) and have Most Vulnerable Children's Committees (MVCC) in place.  This in turn means that data on child protection will be available from nearly 80% of the districts in Tanzania in the coming years
